alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 11:30AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Garfield and southwestern Wayne Counties through 1215 PM MDT... At 1130 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Torrey, or 9 miles west of Capitol Reef National Park, moving east at 10 mph. Additional thunderstorms are developing south and west of the main storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park, Torrey, Teasdale and Fruita. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 12 between mile markers 105 and 122. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 68 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Southern Mountains
